title: Drawing, "Thetis in the Workshop of Hephaestus; Thetis Showing the Armor to Achilles: Two Designs for Ceiling Panels in the Galeria d'Iliade, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1802–05
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray-brown wash over graphite on white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite above each drawing, upper right: 4 Tetide fa fabbricare le armi per Achille; center right: Tetide porta le armi ad Achille; in graphite, light source symbols at upper left and center right
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: In upper drawing, Vulcan shows shield made for Achilles to Thetis. In lower drawing, Thetis shows armor to Achilles, who sits in his tent beside dead Patroclus. Girl mourns; warriors observe from behind.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Thetis in the Workshop of Hephaestus; Thetis Showing the Armor to Achilles: Two Designs for Ceiling Panels in the Galeria d'Iliade, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1802–05.
1802–05. Pen and brown ink, brush and gray-brown wash over graphite on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3328.
